title: Donington on Bain Walks

images.title: Dennis Wetherley, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old Mill Donnington on Bain. This former water mill on the river Bain is now a private residence.

images.title: St Andrew's Church, Donington on Bain by J.Hannan-Briggs, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St Andrew's Church, Donington on Bain. The Grade II listed 12th century church includes a Norman font.

images.title: Donington on Bain Village Hall by J.Hannan-Briggs, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Donington on Bain Village Hall

images.title: Tim Heaton / Lake on the River Bain, Biscathorpe
images.caption: Lake on the River Bain, Biscathorpe. A site of 'Nature Conservation Importance'

images.title: David Wright / Ford on the River Bain near Biscathorpe
images.caption: Ford on the River Bain near Biscathorpe

images.title: David Wright / Church of St. Helen, Biscathorpe
images.caption: Church of St. Helen, Biscathorpe. The church sits between Burgh on Bain and Donington on Bain, just off the High Street. It was consecrated in 1847, rebuilt in 1850 and restored in 1913. The church seats only about 60.

images.title: David Wright / Site of Deserted Medieval Village
images.caption: Site of Deserted Medieval Village, Biscathorpe.

images.title: Gayton-le-Wold by Richard Croft, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Gayton-le-Wold

description: This pretty village is located in the Lincolnshire Wolds AONB, on the banks of the River Bain. It's a great place to start a walk with some beautiful countryside, river views, a 12th century church and a fine 18th century pub to relax in afterwards. This circular walk from the village first heads north along a section of the Viking Way to Biscathorpe where you will find the site of a deserted medieval village. This opening section follows the River Bain, passing a small lake on the way. The route then heads east to Gayton le Wold, passing Gayton Manor on the way. You then follow some country trails south through farmland before turning east back to the village.
